ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: minotaur horn change?
ygData.msgSnippet: Client does a check when a drop action is initiated. Is the No Drop switch set to Drop? if yes drop the item. Is the No Drop switch set to confirm? if yes then
ygData.messageBody:
Client does a check when a drop action is initiated.
Is the No Drop switch set to Drop? if yes drop the item.
Is the No Drop switch set to confirm? if yes then Confirm.
Is the No Drop switch set to No Drop? If yes then display "You have chosen
not to drop items, if you wish to drop this item please change your No Drop
setting"

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 12:44 PM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: minotaur horn change?
>
>
> I'm not sure how they could code that without tagging them as
> No Drop. I
> think that's the whole reason they haven't done it, it would
> require a lot
> of changes to make items undroppable without tagging them as
> No Drop in some
> fashion.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: beatdropbattledrum@...
> [mailto:beatdropbattledrum@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 1:46 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: minotaur horn change?
>
>
> I think what Rokenn means is that it wouldn't TAG your items as NO
> DROP but that you just simply will not be able to drop them. Doesn't
> that make sense?
>
> ~Beatdrop
>
> --- In eqbards@egroups.com, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@d...> wrote:
> > No Drop items cannot be looted from another player in PvP unless
> they
> > changed that recently. If I could tag all my items as No Drop it
> would have
> > a dramatic effect on looting in PvP.
> >
> > Kit
> >
> > Please use some common sense, this would have no effect on looting.
> >
> > Rokenn
>
>
